statements: SELECT * FROM UserPermissions WHERE user_id = 1;
SELECT user_id, access_level, role_id FROM UserPermissions WHERE access_level > 2;
SELECT * FROM UserPermissions WHERE access_level < 2 ORDER BY access_level ASC;
SELECT user_id, role_id FROM UserPermissions WHERE user_id = 2 AND role_id = 1;
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM UserPermissions;
SELECT user_id, role_id, access_level FROM UserPermissions WHERE access_level > 5 ORDER BY role_id DESC, user_id ASC LIMIT 10
SELECT user_id, role_id, access_level FROM UserPermissions WHERE role_id = 3 ORDER BY user_id DESC LIMIT 5
SELECT user_id, role_id, access_level FROM UserPermissions WHERE role_id IN (1, 2, 3) AND access_level < 5 ORDER BY access_level ASC, user_id DESC
SELECT user_id, AVG(access_level) AS avg_access_level FROM UserPermissions GROUP BY user_id HAVING AVG(access_level) > 3
SELECT user_id, COUNT(role_id) AS role_count FROM UserPermissions GROUP BY user_id HAVING COUNT(role_id) >= 2
SELECT * FROM UserPermissions WHERE user_id = 1;
SELECT role_id, access_level FROM UserPermissions WHERE material_id = 3;
SELECT id, role_name FROM Roles ORDER BY role_name DESC;
SELECT * FROM UserPermissions WHERE access_level > 2;
SELECT user_id, COUNT(*) FROM UserPermissions GROUP BY user_id;
SELECT * FROM UserPermissions WHERE user_id = 1 AND access_level > 2;
SELECT role_name, description FROM Roles WHERE id = 2;
SELECT user_id, role_id, access_level FROM UserPermissions WHERE material_id IN (1, 2, 3);
SELECT * FROM UserPermissions ORDER BY access_level DESC, user_id ASC;
SELECT user_id, role_name FROM UserPermissions JOIN Roles ON UserPermissions.role_id = Roles.id;
SELECT * FROM users;
SELECT id, name, role FROM users WHERE role='admin';
SELECT id, email FROM users WHERE name='John Smith';
SELECT * FROM roles ORDER BY name DESC;
SELECT id, resource FROM permissions WHERE role_id='123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000';
SELECT * FROM users WHERE role = 'admin';
SELECT id, name FROM users ORDER BY name DESC;
SELECT name, email FROM users WHERE name LIKE 'J%' AND email LIKE '%@example.com';
SELECT u.name, r.name AS role_name FROM users u JOIN roles r ON u.role = r.id;
SELECT p.resource, r.name AS role_name FROM permissions p JOIN roles r ON p.role_id = r.id ORDER BY p.resource ASC;
SELECT * FROM users;
SELECT username, role_id FROM users ORDER BY role_id DESC;
SELECT user_id, username, role_id FROM users WHERE role_id = 1;
SELECT users.user_id, users.username, roles.role_name FROM users INNER JOIN roles ON users.role_id = roles.role_id;

SELECT users.username, permissions.permission_name FROM users JOIN user_permissions ON users.user_id = user_permissions.user_id JOIN permissions ON user_permissions.permission_id = permissions.permission_id;
SELECT * FROM users;
SELECT username, role_id FROM users ORDER BY username DESC;

SELECT u.username, r.role_name, p.permission_name FROM users u JOIN roles r ON u.role_id = r.role_id JOIN user_permissions up ON u.user_id = up.user_id JOIN permissions p ON up.permission_id = p.permission_id;
SELECT u.username, r.role_name FROM users u LEFT JOIN roles r ON u.role_id = r.role_id WHERE u.user_id = 1;
SELECT COUNT(user_id) AS total_users, COUNT(DISTINCT role_id) AS total_roles FROM users;
SELECT * FROM roles;
SELECT role_name, role_id FROM roles ORDER BY role_name;
SELECT user_id, username FROM users WHERE role_id = 1;
SELECT material_name FROM materials WHERE material_id = 2;
SELECT user_id, permission_id FROM user_permissions WHERE user_id = 5;
SELECT * FROM roles;
SELECT user_id, username FROM users WHERE role_id = 1 ORDER BY username DESC;
SELECT material_name, content FROM materials WHERE material_name LIKE '%data%' ORDER BY material_id ASC;
SELECT u.username, p.permission_name FROM users u INNER JOIN user_permissions up ON u.user_id = up.user_id INNER JOIN permissions p ON up.permission_id = p.permission_id;

SELECT u.username, r.role_name, COUNT(up.permission_id) AS num_permissions FROM users u INNER JOIN roles r ON u.role_id = r.role_id LEFT JOIN user_permissions up ON u.user_id = up.user_id GROUP BY u.user_id HAVING num_permissions > 2;
